Class PartitionDistributor

java.lang.Object
SystemEnvironment.PartitionDistributor
public class PartitionDistributor extends Object
Distributes tasks across processor cores using a pluggable partition algorithm.

This lightweight facade holds a PartitionAlgorithm strategy and a reference to the owning Processor. When split() is invoked, it delegates to the algorithm to assign tasks in the processor's TaskSet to its available cores (i.e., using Processor#getAllCore and Processor#getTaskSet).

The original inline section markers (Operating/SetValue/GetValue) are reflected here: set the algorithm and the parent processor first, then operate; finally, getters expose the current configuration.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • PartitionDistributor

      public PartitionDistributor()
      Creates a distributor with no algorithm and no parent processor set. Call setPartitionAlgorithm(PartitionAlgorithm) and setParentProcessor(Processor) before split().

  • Method Details

    • split

      public void split()
      Executes the configured partition algorithm to assign tasks to cores.

      Delegates to the underlying algorithm (typically via taskToCore(...)) using the parent processor's current list of cores and its TaskSet.

      Preconditions: both the partition algorithm and the parent processor should be set prior to calling this method.

    • setPartitionAlgorithm

      public void setPartitionAlgorithm(PartitionAlgorithm a)
      Installs the partitioning strategy used to distribute tasks to cores.
      Parameters:
      a - the PartitionAlgorithm implementation to use

    • setParentProcessor

      public void setParentProcessor(Processor p)
      Sets the parent processor whose cores and task set are used during partitioning.
      Parameters:
      p - the target Processor

    • getSPartitionAlgorithm

      public PartitionAlgorithm getSPartitionAlgorithm()
      Returns the currently configured partition algorithm.
      Returns:
      the PartitionAlgorithm, or null if none is set

    • getParentProcessor

      public Processor getParentProcessor()
      Returns the parent processor that this distributor operates on.
      Returns:
      the Processor, or null if not set
